sen.j: 坂上 国麻呂（さかのうえ の くにまろ、生没年不詳）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: Sakanoue no Kunimaro (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period of Japan.
SAKANOUE no Kunimaro (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period of Japan.
SAKANOUE no Kunimaro (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period of Japan.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「さかのうへのくにまろ」。
sen.e: His name was read as 'Sakanouhe no Kunimaro' in old Japanese syllabary characters.
His name was read as 'Sakanouhe no Kunimaro' in old Japanese syllabary characters.
His name was read as 'Sakanouhe no Kunimaro' in old Japanese syllabary characters.
His Kabane (hereditary title) was Atai.
His Kabane (hereditary title) was Atai.
His Kabane (hereditary title) was Atai.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大海人皇子（天武天皇）側の高市皇子に従って都を脱した。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War in 672, he left the capital following Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) on the side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) (Emperor Tenmu).
In the Jinshin War in 672, he left the capital following Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) on the side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) (Emperor Tenmu).
In the Jinshin War in 672, he left the capital following Takechi no Miko (Prince Takechi) on the side of Oama no Miko (Prince Oama) (Emperor Tenmu).

sen.j: 坂上氏は倭漢氏（東漢氏）に属する渡来系の氏族である。
sen.e: The Sakanoue clan was a Toraikei Shizoku (a clan who immigrated to Japan from China or Korea).
The Sakanoue clan was a Toraikei Shizoku (a clan who immigrated to Japan from China or Korea) who belonged to the Yamato no aya clan.
sen.cmt: 「倭漢氏（東漢氏）に属する」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。
sen.e: The Sakanoue clan was a Toraikei Shizoku (a clan who immigrated to Japan from China or Korea) who belonged to the Yamato no aya clan.

sen.j: 壬申の乱が勃発したとき、坂上国麻呂は近江近江宮にいたらしい。
sen.e: When the Jinshin War broke out, Sakanoue no Kunimaro seems to have been in Omi no miya in the Omi Province.
When the Jinshin War broke out, SAKANOUE no Kunimaro seems to have been in Omi no miya in the Omi Province.
When the Jinshin War broke out, SAKANOUE no Kunimaro seems to have been in Omi no miya in the Omi Province.

sen.j: 大津京にいた高市皇子は、父の大海人皇子の挙兵を知って京を脱出し、6月25日に鹿深を越えて積殖山口で大海人皇子の一行に合流した。
sen.e: When Takechi no Miko who was in Otsu-kyo came to know the rising of his father, Oama no Miko, he escaped from the capital, went over Kafuka and joined Oama no Miko and his party in Tsumue yamaguchi on July 28.
sen.cmt: 「天武天皇元年6月25日」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦672年7月28日」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: When Takechi no Miko in Otsu-kyo came to know the rising of his father, Oama no Miko, he escaped from the capital, went over Kafuka and joined Oama no Miko and his party in Tsumue yamaguchi on July 28.
sen.cmt: who was in Otsu-kyo→in Otsu-kyoとしました。
sen.e: When Takechi no Miko in Otsu-kyo came to know the rising of his father, Oama no Miko, he escaped from the capital, went over Kafuka and joined Oama no Miko and his party in Tsumue yamaguchi on July 28.

sen.j: このとき高市皇子に従っていたのが、民大火、赤染徳足、大蔵広隅、坂上国麻呂、古市黒麻呂、竹田大徳、胆香瓦安倍であった。
sen.e: Those who followed Takechi no Miko at that time were Tami no Ohi, Akasome no Tokotari, OKURA no Hirosumi, Sakanoue no Kunimaro, Furuichi no Kuromaro, Takeda no Daitoku and Ikago no Ahe.
Those who followed Takechi no Miko at that time were TAMI no Ohi, AKASOME no Tokotari, OKURA no Hirosumi, SAKANOUE no Kunimaro, FURUICHI no Kuromaro, TAKEDA no Daitoku and IKAGO no Ahe.
sen.cmt: TAMI no Ohi, AKASOME no Tokotari, SAKANOUE no Kunimaro, FURUICHI no Kuromaro, TAKEDA no Daitoku, IKAGO no Aheとしました。
sen.e: Those who followed Takechi no Miko at that time were TAMI no Ohi, AKASOME no Tokotari, OKURA no Hirosumi, SAKANOUE no Kunimaro, FURUICHI no Kuromaro, TAKEDA no Daitoku and IKAGO no Ahe.

sen.j: 鹿深は近江国甲賀郡のあたりである。
sen.e: Kafuka was around Koga-gun County, Omi Province.
Kafuka was around Koka County, Omi Province.
Kafuka was around Koka County, Omi Province.

sen.j: 積殖山口は後の伊賀国阿拝郡柘植郷（現在の伊賀市柘植）と推定され、当時は伊勢国に属した。
sen.e: Tsumue yamaguchi is assumed to have been a place which later became Tsuge-go, Ae-gun County, Iga Province (present Tsuge, Iga City), which belonged to Ise Province at that time.
Tsumue yamaguchi is assumed to have been a place which later became Tsuge-go, Ahai County, Iga Province (present Tsuge, Iga City), which belonged to Ise Province at that time.
Tsumue yamaguchi is assumed to have been a place which later became Tsuge-go, Ahai County, Iga Province (present Tsuge, Iga City), which belonged to Ise Province at that time.

sen.j: 国麻呂のその後の行動については記録がない。
sen.e: There is no record of Kunimaro's activities after that.
There is no record of Kunimaro's activities after that.
There is no record of Kunimaro's activities after that.
